snippet: Since Friday, six explosions have hit hotels, a Buddhist pagoda, and restaurants in Yangon and two regions north and northeast of the city.
abstract: Series of unexplained blasts in Yangon, Myanmar, and elsewhere in country has left two people dead and raised anxiety levels; some authorities speculate that motive for attacks may have been to scuttle negotiations between minority ethnic groups, government and military.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: Since Friday, six explosions have hit hotels, a Buddhist pagoda, and restaurants in Yangon and two regions north and northeast of the city.

headline.main: Blasts Kill 2 and Injure an American in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: Blasts Kill 2 And Injure An American In Myanmar
